A bundle of fungoid-like creepers all gathered and joined at one end to a body sack, which is a pulsating mass of glistening flesh, within which is a circular shaped mouth. Yet, all can assume other forms to blend in with their prey while seeking to bend the will of others to their command.
monster_entry.main_entry_text: A race of space-faring vampiric entities who journey through the cosmos in an immense and strange-looking spacecraft. They lay dormant within their vessel until they reach a world with inhabitants suitable to their vampiric needs. On arrival at a new world, the nioth-korghai are able to alter their physicality to resemble the indigenous life forms... Nioth-korghai worship the Outer God known as Ubbo Sathla.

powers_and_abilities.name: Change Form
powers_and_abilities.description: Cost 5D10 POW (regained over time). Can mimic nearby lifeforms or objects.

powers_and_abilities.name: Possession
powers_and_abilities.description: Can mentally possess intelligent life forms by winning an opposed POW roll. Control is absolute within 20 miles.

powers_and_abilities.name: Life Drain
powers_and_abilities.description: Feeds on life force by grasping victim and leeching 3D10 POW per round (plus 2D8 CON and APP loss). Victim ages dramatically. If drained to 0 POW/CON, victim dies and becomes a vampiric zombie.

powers_and_abilities.name: Energy Blast
powers_and_abilities.description: Expends POW to create psychic blast. 5 POW = 1D6 damage.

attacks.name: Grab (Maneuver)
attacks.description: Can attempt possession or life drain.

attacks.name: Energy Blast
attacks.description: See Powers.

monster_entry.name: Ny'ghan Grii
monster_entry.subtitle: Extra-dimensional Travelers
monster_entry.description: Possessing round, globe-like, bodies curiously flattened at either end and covered in numerous slender tentacles that give it a rugose appearance. A great faceted eye grew from the bulk, below which a mouth, more like a puckered orifice, from which icy cold air would emerge. The flesh was semi-translucent and ivory in color: repellent and suggestive of pale and leprous things.
monster_entry.main_entry_text: The ny'ghan grii are luminous spherical creatures from another dimension. They move by floating or crawling and are accompanied by thick fog and icy cold. They lurk at interdimensional Gates or nexus points... Parasitic, they seem able to enter other dimensions by attaching themselves to other entities and "piggybacking" their way through.

powers_and_abilities.name: Devolution
powers_and_abilities.description: Can cause an individual to devolve into a primitive version of its species. Requires opposed POW roll. Process takes 2D6 rounds and is usually irreversible. Witnessing causes 1/1D6 Sanity loss.

powers_and_abilities.name: Chilling Blast
powers_and_abilities.description: Numbing icy air pours from its mass (2 yards diameter). Causes 1D4 damage per round. Costs 2 MP per round.

attacks.name: Chilling Blast
attacks.description: See Powers.

armor.modifiers: Resistant to cold.

monster_entry.spells: Roll INT to determine if 1D6 spells are known.

monster_entry.name: Nyogtha, Spawn of
monster_entry.subtitle: Children of Darkness
monster_entry.description: Nyogtha creates its spawn from vile unions, its progeny taking human seeming shape at first before coming to resemble a shapeless bloated thing with gray-black rotted flesh, squirming as though filled with large black worms. Despite such foul appearance, the spawn wear once-human fang-filled faces and possess skeletal hands from which sharp talons extend. Hellish bulging eyes of crimson hue reveal little trace of humanity.
alternative_names: Spawn of the Thing That Should Not Be
monster_entry.main_entry_text: The spawn of Nyogtha issue from blasphemous unions between the Great Old One Nyogtha and humans or ghouls. Such spawn swiftly degenerate into shapeless abominations after three to six decades, but at first resemble humans, able to pass within society. The transformation from human-like to fully matured spawn begins with hideous black splotches appearing on the flesh... The human form's skeleton warps and distorts into a parody of itself... while the flesh continues to bloat and blacken like a rotting corpse.

powers_and_abilities.name: Not Quite Human
powers_and_abilities.description: Close examination may reveal that a viscous black ichor pulses through its veins rather than blood.

powers_and_abilities.name: Photosensitivity
powers_and_abilities.description: As a spawn matures, they become photosensitive (usually around age 16). Sunlight causes excruciating pain. Easily blinded by bright light but have excellent night vision.

attacks.name: Enfold (Monstrous Maneuver)
attacks.description: Target pulled into gelatinous flesh. Tendrils sprout and bore into body (1D6 damage + 1/1D6 Sanity loss). Victim must succeed Extreme CON or take 1D4 suffocation damage/round. Can enfold up to 3 targets.

armor.modifiers: All impaling weapons (incl. bullets) deal minimum possible damage; immune to fire, chemical, radioactivity, and electrical based attacks.

monster_entry.spells: Contact Nyogtha (once in contact). Monstrous spawn know 2D6 spells.

monster_entry.name: Nyogtha, Spawn of (Variant)
monster_entry.subtitle: Children of Darkness
monster_entry.description: Nyogtha creates its spawn from vile unions, its progeny taking human seeming shape at first before coming to resemble a shapeless bloated thing with gray-black rotted flesh, squirming as though filled with large black worms... Hellish bulging eyes of crimson hue reveal little trace of humanity.
alternative_names: Spawn of the Thing That Should Not Be
monster_entry.main_entry_text: The spawn of Nyogtha issue from blasphemous unions between the Great Old One Nyogtha and humans or ghouls. Such spawn swiftly degenerate into shapeless abominations after three to six decades... The metamorphosis complete, the monstrous form is a shapeless horror. Serving the will of Nyogtha, the spawn appears to be tasked with inducting new recruits into the worship of their sire.

powers_and_abilities.name: Photosensitivity
powers_and_abilities.description: As a spawn matures, they become photosensitive; the mere touch of sunlight on their exposed flesh causes excruciating pain. They are easily blinded by bright light.

attacks.name: Enfold (Maneuver)
attacks.description: Target is pulled into contact. Worm-like tendrils coil and force into body (1D6 damage + Sanity loss). Victim must also make Extreme CON roll or take 1D4 suffocation damage per round.

armor.modifiers: All impaling weapons (incl. bullets) deal minimum damage; immune to fire, chemical, radioactivity, and electrical based attacks.

monster_entry.name: Old Ones, Fosterlings of the
monster_entry.subtitle: Children of Alien Gods
monster_entry.description: It was unstable, a swollen bulk whose pale pink skin glistened as though flayed, with a bulb-like head possessing a lumpy forehead and covered in patches of hair-like strands of thin flesh. Despite its cursed origin, the taint of humanity could be seen.
monster_entry.main_entry_text: Fosterlings of the Old Ones are the offspring of magical unions between humans and Outer Gods or Great Old Ones. Each resultant child is unique, with some resembling more the form of its Mythos parent, while others appear human... Once born, the resulting child can spend many years as a normal human until one day it transforms into something more closely resembling its alien parent. In some cases, child never fully transforms and remains "human" until death, but in life passes the taint of the Mythos to their own children.

powers_and_abilities.name: Special Powers
powers_and_abilities.description: Each fosterling is different. May include mind reading, mind control, prophetic visions, telekinesis, levitation, etc. (Keeper determined).

skills.name: Varies
skills.value: Retains human skills but at penalty due to size/body.

armor.modifiers: Minimal damage from mundane weapons (incl. bullets).

monster_entry.spells: All fosterlings may Call their parent deity and Summon/Bind or Contact members of that deity's allied races; those with INT 90 know at least 1D6 spells.

monster_entry.name: Old Ones, Fosterlings of the (Variant)
monster_entry.subtitle: Children of Alien Gods
monster_entry.description: It was unstable, a swollen bulk whose pale pink skin glistened as though flayed, with a bulb-like head possessing a lumpy forehead and covered in patches of hair-like strands of thin flesh. Despite its cursed origin, the taint of humanity could be seen.
monster_entry.main_entry_text: Fosterlings of the Old Ones are the offspring of magical unions between humans and Outer Gods or Great Old Ones. Each resultant child is unique, with some resembling more the form of its Mythos parent, while others appear human... In many cases, the genetic Mythos-alterations are passed from generation to generation; each successive generation becomes more like the parent deity.

powers_and_abilities.name: Unique Power
powers_and_abilities.description: Most fosterlings have one or two powers upon reaching adulthood (e.g., mind reading, mind control, prophetic visions, telekinesis, levitation).

armor.modifiers: Minimal damage from mundane weapons (incl. bullets).

monster_entry.spells: All may Call parent deity and Summon/Bind allied races; INT 90+ knows at least 1D6 spells.

monster_entry.name: Outer Gods, Larvae of the
monster_entry.subtitle: Spawn of Impossible Alien Forces
monster_entry.description: A company of entities, they number among those who dance for Azathoth at the center of all things. They spawn monstrous larvae which may, in time, grow into new gods. Each is nameless for now and possessed of nameless hungers.
monster_entry.main_entry_text: The larvae of the Outer Gods (sometimes Other Gods) are among those beings that dance blindly and idiotically in the court of Azathoth at the center of space and time. Occasionally, portions of these beings are torn off or ejected into the depths of space, and sometimes become living beings unto themselves... These entities may be of any form: insectoid, metal, liquid, gaseous, crystalline, living machine, geometrical, amorphous, phosphorous, fiery, mammalian, living sound, living color, and so on.

attacks.name: Fighting
attacks.special_effect: Attacks vary by form (tentacle, poison gas, bite, smash, claw, engulf, etc.).

armor.modifiers: Immune to cold and vacuum; certain forms may have other vulnerabilities.

monster_entry.sanity_loss: Varies dependent on form; from 0/1D10 to 1D8/5D10.

monster_entry.name: Outer Gods, Larvae of the (Variant)
monster_entry.subtitle: Spawn of Impossible Alien Forces
monster_entry.description: A company of entities, they number among those who dance for Azathoth at the center of all things. They spawn monstrous larvae which may, in time, grow into new gods. Each is nameless for now and possessed of nameless hungers.
monster_entry.main_entry_text: The larvae of the Outer Gods (sometimes Other Gods) are among those beings that dance blindly and idiotically in the court of Azathoth at the center of space and time. Occasionally, portions of these beings are torn off or ejected into the depths of space, and sometimes become living beings unto themselves... These entities may be of any form: insectoid, metal, liquid, gaseous, crystalline, living machine, geometrical, amorphous, phosphorous, fiery, mammalian, living sound, living color, and so on.

attacks.name: Fighting
attacks.special_effect: Attacks according to individual form (tentacle, poison gas, bite, smash, etc.).

armor.modifiers: Immune to cold and vacuum; certain forms may have other vulnerabilities.

monster_entry.name: Outer Gods, Servitor of the
monster_entry.subtitle: The Piping Ones
monster_entry.description: At the center of all things lies Azathoth... surrounded by the servitors. These beings are best described as amorphous masses, fluid like and bubbling, yet sometimes taking on more solid forms resembling caricatures of toads, octopi, and squids. From them comes a ghastly ululation, a piping song which pleases Azathoth and ensures his unending sleep... lest he wake and in so doing give vent to primal destruction and end all things.
monster_entry.main_entry_text: These amorphous beings progress by rolling, slithering, or lurching. Their ever-changing shapes are a blasphemous contortion, making description difficult... Servitors may be found accompanying Mythos deities, though they are most commonly found in Azathoth's Court. These are the "demon flautists" playing flute-like music for their masters. The noise is best described as a sort of background dirge rising to a maddening cacophony of piping.

powers_and_abilities.name: Music of Madness
powers_and_abilities.description: Discordant music adversely affects human listeners. Provokes a Sanity roll every two rounds (0/1D4 loss).

attacks.name: Fighting
attacks.special_effect: A mass of writhing tentacles batters and swipes. Each successful hit inflicts damage from 1D3 tentacles.

attacks.name: Tentacle Grab (Maneuver)
attacks.description: Can grab up to four targets (range 20 yards). Held targets may be crushed (1D6) or flung (2D6 falling damage). Victims can break free with opposed STR/DEX roll.

armor.modifiers: Immune to mundane weapons (incl. bullets); regenerates 3 hit points per round (death at zero hit points).

monster_entry.name: Outer Gods, Servitor of the (Variant)
monster_entry.subtitle: The Piping Ones
monster_entry.description: These beings are best described as amorphous masses, fluid like and bubbling, yet sometimes taking on more solid forms resembling caricatures of toads, octopi, and squids. From them comes a ghastly ululation, a piping song which pleases Azathoth and ensures his unending sleep.
monster_entry.main_entry_text: These amorphous beings progress by rolling, slithering, or lurching... Servitors may be found accompanying Mythos deities, though they are most commonly found in Azathoth's Court. These are the "demon flautists" playing flute-like music for their masters. The noise is best described as a sort of background dirge rising to a maddening cacophony of piping.

powers_and_abilities.name: Music of Madness
powers_and_abilities.description: The discordant music adversely affects human listeners, provoking a Sanity roll every two rounds (0/1D4 loss).

attacks.name: Fighting
attacks.special_effect: A mass of writhing tentacles batters and swipes. Roll for each of 4 attacks.

attacks.name: Tentacle Grab (Maneuver)
attacks.description: Tentacles have 20 yard range. May grab up to 4 targets. Held targets may be crushed or flung.

armor.modifiers: Immune to mundane weapons (incl. bullets); regenerates 3 hit points per round (death at zero hit points).

monster_entry.spells: Knows 1D10 spells, usually including Summon/Bind and Call.

monster_entry.name: Petesouchi
monster_entry.subtitle: Crocodile People
monster_entry.description: Do not tempt the malice of those who are learned in the arcane lest their ire is turned upon you. For there are those who can unnaturally twist the human form into bestial shape. Look upon the basking crocodile you passed outside and note its eyes. See you the mind within, unable to converse, possessing a mouth through which human speech is impossible. What despair a man whose intellect is forever trapped in inhuman form.
monster_entry.main_entry_text: Differing opinions arise concerning the crocodile people known as petesouchi. Some are said to be transformed by dark spells perpetrated by vengeful sorcerers, while others are considered to have a tainted bloodline that turns a human being into a crocodile... Unlike deep ones, however, their final mature form is that of an enormous crocodile with human intelligence. Unable to communicate with other humans or even their own children, they are cursed to remain nearby but forever isolated from their families.

attacks.name: Roll
attacks.description: Bites victim and goes into classic crocodile roll to crush, twist, and snap.

monster_entry.sanity_loss: 0/1D4 to encounter adult; 0/1D6 to encounter transforming.

monster_entry.name: Petesouchi (Variant)
monster_entry.subtitle: Crocodile People
monster_entry.description: Look upon the basking crocodile you passed outside and note its eyes. See you the mind within, unable to converse, possessing a mouth through which human speech is impossible. What despair a man whose intellect is forever trapped in inhuman form.
monster_entry.main_entry_text: Differing opinions arise concerning the crocodile people known as petesouchi. Some are said to be transformed by dark spells perpetrated by vengeful sorcerers, while others are considered to have a tainted bloodline... For those possessing a tainted bloodline, they change in a manner similar to deep ones... the final mature form is that of an enormous crocodile with human intelligence.

attacks.name: Roll
attacks.description: Bites victim and then goes into a classic crocodile roll, crushing, twisting, and snapping.

monster_entry.sanity_loss: 0/1D4 to encounter adult; 0/1D6 to encounter transforming.

monster_entry.name: Rat-Thing
monster_entry.subtitle: Malevolent Spies
monster_entry.description: It followed the witch like a pet, attentive and knowing. A familiar of sorts, it appeared as a large rat yet its face was that of a person, with human eyes, nose, and mouth. The face was one of malice and unkindness, and, when it opened its mouth it revealed sharp teeth. The body was in all other respects that of a rodent, with matted fur, four legs, and a long pinkish tail. I could not be sure in the dim light, but its claws seemed more like tiny fingers.
monster_entry.main_entry_text: While easily mistaken for normal rats at a distance, in close proximity, their unnaturalness becomes apparent. Rat-things are small, hairy rodents with rat bodies, evil-looking human faces, and tiny human hands for paws... It is unknown whether they are a distinct race or the result of malign sorcery, as some have been encountered in the role of familiar to a witch or wizard... Brown Jenkin, the familiar of the witch Keziah Mason, was a rat-thing.

powers_and_abilities.name: Magical Assistance
powers_and_abilities.description: May aid a sorcerer, providing a bonus die to Cthulhu Mythos rolls. Can give up POW to aid spell casting (1 POW = 5 MP). Can open temporary Gates (cost 10 POW).

attacks.name: Fighting
attacks.special_effect: Climbs up legs/clothes. Once successful, bites down hard and clings on (1D4-1 damage/round). Tearing away causes 1D3 damage.

armor.modifiers: Attacks to hit a running rat-thing are made with one penalty die.

monster_entry.spells: 30% chance of knowing 1D3 spells; humans transformed retain knowledge.
monster_entry.sanity_loss: 0/1D6; 1/1D6+2 if the face is of a known human.

monster_entry.name: Rat-Thing (Variant)
monster_entry.subtitle: Malevolent Spies
monster_entry.description: It followed the witch like a pet, attentive and knowing. A familiar of sorts, it appeared as a large rat yet its face was that of a person, with human eyes, nose, and mouth. The face was one of malice and unkindness, and, when it opened its mouth it revealed sharp teeth. The body was in all other respects that of a rodent, with matted fur, four legs, and a long pinkish tail.
monster_entry.main_entry_text: Rat-things are small, hairy rodents with rat bodies, evil-looking human faces, and tiny human hands for paws... It is unknown whether they are a distinct race or the result of malign sorcery, as some have been encountered in the role of familiar to a witch or wizard... Sometimes, a witch's faithful servant may be transformed into a rat-thing, thereby enabled to continue to serve its mistress.

powers_and_abilities.name: Magical Assistance
powers_and_abilities.description: May aid a sorcerer, providing a bonus die to Cthulhu Mythos rolls. Can give up POW to aid spell casting (1 POW = 5 MP). May twist angles to open temporary Gates (cost 10 POW).

attacks.name: Fighting
attacks.special_effect: Bites and clings on, raking and chewing (1D4-1 damage). Tearing away causes 1D3 additional damage.

armor.modifiers: Attacks to hit a running rat-thing are made with one penalty die.

monster_entry.spells: 30% chance of knowing 1D3 spells; if a gift from a deity, knows 1D6+.

monster_entry.name: Reanimates
monster_entry.subtitle: Undead Experiments
monster_entry.description: At first, its outline was human, but venturing closer I beheld a thing no longer human. What had once been a man was now a mockery of life, frantic and bereft of nuance, it was bestial. Wounds that had clearly ended the natural life of the thing were now festering sores. It howled in rage and its eyes revealed the sorrow and pain of a thousand torments.
monster_entry.main_entry_text: Reanimates are human zombies created through the injection of certain chemical compounds into a corpse... At best, West's reanimated corpses were near-mindless parodies of their former selves, and, at worst, they were mindless things capable only of lashing out and destroying all around them. Stuck in a state between life and death, unable to truly die, and slowly rotting away, many of West's failed experiments still roam.

armor.modifiers: Suffers half damage from mundane melee weapons; minimum damage from bullets; immune to heat, cold, and electricity; cannot be drowned or suffocated; normal damage from fire or acid.

monster_entry.sanity_loss: 0/1D6. 1/1D8 for a truly horrible 'not fresh' specimen or former friend.

monster_entry.name: S'glhuo, Denizens of
monster_entry.subtitle: Living Sound
monster_entry.description: From outside our world they come, creatures best described as sentient sound, although at times they seem to take on semi-physical forms that resemble tall, thin figures with blank, pupil-less eyes and a skin of blue scales that seem to constantly ripple.
monster_entry.main_entry_text: In the Gulf of S'glhuo, in a strange and distant universe, all the worlds and their inhabitants are composed of sound. When able to enter our world, they may take on semi-corporeal shapes looking vaguely reptilian... The denizens of S'glhuo can mentally project messages over incredible distances. Humans pick up these messages as dreams or inner voices.

attacks.name: Sonic Blast
attacks.special_effect: Ignores mundane armor and cannot be dodged. Causes eardrums to bleed and ruptures flesh.

armor.modifiers: Immune to all physical damage. Vulnerable to certain spells affecting INT/POW and discordant sounds (1D4-1D6 damage).

monster_entry.name: Sand-Dweller
monster_entry.subtitle: Desert Lurkers
monster_entry.description: They are not like earthly carbon-based forms, as the people of the sands are comprised of silicon crystal material... Over time, these sand-dwellers accumulate crusts of sand and silicates around their bodies, forming a rudimentary armor while also acting as camouflage. Many appear in human-like bipedal shapes but others have differing forms. Know them by their two large black eyes, small nose, misshapen, cruel mouths of sharp teeth, and claw-like feet and hands.
monster_entry.main_entry_text: To some scholars, sand-dwellers appear to be an offshoot of hominid evolutionary development... while others suggest that they are unlike other earthly forms and comprised of silicon crystal material. Sand-dwellers are reported to be immortal... In practical terms, sand-dwellers look like moving sand sculptures. Their primary habitat is the Great Hive, which reaches downwards to the horrific Abyss of Yoth.

powers_and_abilities.name: Sand Form
powers_and_abilities.description: Particularly ancient sand-dwellers may alter their shape... Two or more may be combined to form larger individuals for ritual purposes or when need arises. Costs 5 MP, lasts one hour.

monster_entry.name: Serpent People
monster_entry.subtitle: Full Atavism
monster_entry.description: Tall and slender they were, with scaled skin upon humanoid forms dressed in robes or tunics, with two legs and arms, a long neck, and a strong tail. Ophidian heads possessing two eyes, a lipless mouth containing a forked tongue, and simple holes for ears. Indeed, these majestic snakes did craft wondrous science and magic.
monster_entry.main_entry_text: Serpent people are a refined and cultured race whose first kingdom, Valusia, flourished before even dinosaurs walked the Earth... They were great sorcerers, devoting their energy to magical workings and brewing potent poisons... A few lurking remnants of the serpent race survive, hibernating in sealed chambers hidden deep in the earth... waking to assess whether the time has come to repopulate the planet.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.special_effect: Victim must succeed in an Extreme CON roll or suffer 1D8 damage.

monster_entry.name: Shaggai, Human Hybrids of
monster_entry.subtitle: Shan-Human Hybrids
monster_entry.description: Born of an egg, at first seeming human... Reborn, the true shaggai emerges, a giant wasp-like-humanoid insect-creature with iridescent skin, multi-faceted eyes, a proboscis, and wings.
monster_entry.main_entry_text: The shaggai are a hybrid race, half-human and half-shan. They hatch from a maggot-like egg cell as human babies, continuing to grow and develop as humans until they reach puberty, at which time they molt into enormous humanoid insect-like creatures... Shaggai do not possess any of the abilities of their shan ancestors... They derive sustenance through a combination of shan-like photosynthesis and the consumption of food.

attacks.name: Proboscis Attack
attacks.special_effect: Shoots caustic acid (1 yard range). Dissolves flesh causing 1D3 damage + APP loss. Acid continues to damage until washed off. Eats through armor.

monster_entry.name: Shan (Insect from Shaggai)
monster_entry.subtitle: Mental Parasites
monster_entry.description: It is written the Shan were marooned here, unable to return to the void... When revealed, they are insect-like, possessing large eyes, tendrils, and ten legs, all festooned with shining black tentacles. Beneath their carapace is a pale underbelly into which their legs can fold. Able to leap from human to human by flying on their two semi-circular wings comprised of triangular scales.
monster_entry.main_entry_text: The insects from Shaggai are para-dimensional insect beings... The shan are a fugitive race, their home planet or dimension, known as Shaggai, was destroyed... Unfortunately, those who came to Earth found they could not escape, as the planet's atmosphere contains a certain component that prevents them from teleporting away... Unable to move on from Earth's confines, the shan have sought to manipulate humanity, possessing key people to advance their alien agenda.

powers_and_abilities.name: Meld
powers_and_abilities.description: Can phase into a target's brain (cost 1 MP). If shan wins opposed POW, it settles in. Host may be unaware.

powers_and_abilities.name: Mental Attack
powers_and_abilities.description: Once inside, can inject memories and thoughts. At night, can pre-program host. Progressively causes insanity.

attacks.name: Nerve Whip
attacks.special_effect: Projects pallid light. Opposed POW roll: Shan wins = target writhes in agony (incapacitated). Shan fails = target suffers penalty die. Beam can be continued.

monster_entry.name: Shantak
monster_entry.subtitle: Elephantine Mounts
monster_entry.description: It came down from the stars upon two wings wrought of scales and sinuous skin rather than feathers, encrusted with rime and niter. It was loathsome and elephantine in shape... A chimera of sorts, seemingly composed of bird, reptile, and equine aspects. Its horse-like head was scaled and monstrous, and its dark eyes were set within deep pits of flesh.
monster_entry.main_entry_text: Shantaks brood in cavernous holes within meteors and other bodies among the stars. Able to fly through the vacuum of space, they are sometimes bound by wizards and servants of the Outer Gods as steeds... Said to be noisome and loathly, they are cantankerous beasts who must be kept in check through the proper bindings lest they unseat and eat their riders. For unknown reasons, shantaks appear to fear nightgaunts.

attacks.name: Bite and Hold (Maneuver)
attacks.description: Grabs prey with bite. Automatic 1D6 damage per round thereafter. Victim may attempt escape with STR or DEX roll; otherwise makes Luck roll each round to avoid being thrown to the ground (2D6 damage).

monster_entry.name: Shoggoth
monster_entry.subtitle: Fetid Iridescences
monster_entry.description: The insane creation of beings now dead, these monstrous nightmares are as plastic columns of black iridescence. Shapeless, yet able to form appendages and limbs at will... Bubbling self-luminous protoplasm, forming and unforming. Once the slaves of their masters, they rose and destroyed a civilization.
monster_entry.main_entry_text: Shoggoths are among the most horrible and loathsome of things. Mighty sacks of protoplasm, roughly five yards/meters in diameter, these amphibious creatures can imitate other life forms, growing limbs, eyes, and other appendages at will. Created by the elder things... shoggoths were used as beasts of burden and to build elder thing cities in prehistory. Over time, mutations caused shoggoths to develop their intellect and will, causing them to rebel.

powers_and_abilities.name: Mimicry
powers_and_abilities.description: Can mimic sounds they hear, from penguin cries to human voices.

attacks.name: Engulf (Maneuver)
attacks.description: Victims must make opposed STR roll or be sucked apart (usually instant death). Damage is DB divided by number of people engulfed.

armor.modifiers: Halve damage from fire and electricity; mundane weapons (incl. bullets) deal 1 damage per hit. Regenerates 2 HP per round (death at zero).

monster_entry.name: Shoggoth Lord
monster_entry.subtitle: Corpulent Monstrosities
monster_entry.description: An expert in shape, this advanced species of shoggoth can blend in with its surroundings, mimicking humans to get as close as possible to its prey... In human form, these beings appear as grossly obese, hairless figures. They are cunning, charming, and devious, although can appear somewhat awkward in their interactions with humans.
monster_entry.main_entry_text: Shoggoth Lords are smaller, more intelligent descendants of their larger monstrous cousins. Through some quirk of evolution... a handful of shoggoths evolved into intelligent creatures able at will to mimic humans in appearance and speech. A shoggoth lord may freely transmute between its human and monstrous forms, but does require great concentration and control to remain in human form for long periods of time.

attacks.name: Engulf (True Form Maneuver)
attacks.description: Seizes target and sucks them into body mass to digest. Opposed STR roll to escape. Can only engulf one victim at a time.

armor.modifiers: Halve damage from fire and electricity; mundane weapons (incl. bullets) deal 1 damage per hit. Regenerates 2 HP per round.

monster_entry.name: Shoggoth, Proto
monster_entry.subtitle: Shape-Shifters
monster_entry.description: Notable is the tissue, characteristic of human flesh, though possessing greater mobility. The live specimen appears to be able to change at will. Its mass is humanoid but features ridges that are apparently muscle and/or bone pushing out through the skin... The subject continually shivers, with distinct rhythmic breathing. Apparently by design, the subject can will the formation of new limbs.
monster_entry.main_entry_text: Proto-shoggoths are not true shoggoths but rather creatures created through science and/or arcane magic. A process of combining the tissue of a human with that of a shoggoth enables the formation of a proto-shoggoth. The tissue is the color and texture of human flesh, though it can change at will. These hybrid creations grow only through the combining and absorption of other proto-shoggoth matter.

attacks.name: Engulf (True Form Maneuver)
attacks.description: Seized and sucked into body mass. Digested for DB damage each round. Opposed STR roll to break free.

armor.modifiers: Mundane weapons (incl. bullets) deal 1 damage per hit. Regenerates 2 HP per round.

monster_entry.spells: None (unless created from human who knew spells).

monster_entry.name: Shub-Niggurath, Child of
monster_entry.subtitle: Seeds of the Mother
monster_entry.description: The chosen one's skin had earlier turned pearlescent but now changed again into a pale milky-yellow color. The transformation was messy and noisy... Pallid bundles of muscle and tentacle growths emerged... It was human in overall shape, but far beyond what might pass as human. It possessed numerous red or yellow eyes and a multitude of small mouths.
monster_entry.main_entry_text: The children of Shub-Niggurath grow from seed pods that take human blood as nourishment... When submerged in fresh human blood, be it in a bowl or within a living body, the pod's outer shell softens and the seed within begins to grow... If growing inside a human, the final stage of maturity sees the monster inside break through the host's skin and rise out of the sloughed-off flesh.

attacks.name: Grab (Maneuver)
attacks.description: Latches onto target and pulls to larger central mouth. Victim can break free with opposed STR roll. If child suffers 5+ damage, victim may make Luck roll to break hold.

armor.modifiers: Minimum damage from bullets. Immune to fire and chemical-based attacks.

monster_entry.spells: Contact Shub-Niggurath, plus 30% chance to know 1D4 spells.

monster_entry.name: Shub-Niggurath, Dark Young of
monster_entry.subtitle: Stomping Horrors
monster_entry.description: An enormous writhing mass formed of ropy black, earthworm like tentacles. Something like twenty feet tall. Here and there, across the surface were great puckered mouths that dripped green goo. Beneath its central mass, two or three thicker tentacles terminated in enormous black hooves, on which it stamped forward. It carried the visage of some ancient gnarled tree when its shape was cast against the moon. The smell was appalling, like the stench of open graves.
monster_entry.main_entry_text: Dark young are often mistakenly attributed to being the 'young' referred to in Shub-Niggurath's epithet... Dark young appear to be most closely connected children of the Dark Mother, often sent in her stead as envoys or heralds to act as proxies... In silhouette, dark young may at first be mistaken for great trees, ranging from 12 to 20 feet (3 to 6 meters) tall.

attacks.name: Grab (Maneuver)
attacks.description: Can grab up to 4 targets. Pulled to mouths and drained of STR. STR loss is permanent. Friends can combine STR to pull victim free.

attacks.name: Trample
attacks.description: Rears up and smashes down on up to 1D4 opponents.

armor.modifiers: Firearms deal 1 damage (2 for impale); shotguns deal minimum damage. Immune to heat, blast, corrosion, electricity, or poison.

monster_entry.name: Space Eater
monster_entry.subtitle: Monstrous Light
monster_entry.description: A shimmering column of bedazzling light composed of multiple ever-twisting and fluctuating beams... The being of light send out limbs, each ending in fronds, or rather hand-like fingers. One of these shot forward to Murfy, touching his forehead and boring through flesh and skull into his brain.
monster_entry.main_entry_text: Space eaters are a monstrous interstellar race of incorporeal beings who appear as shafts of light. While insubstantial, they are able to form temporary limbs to interact with the physical world. Such limbs are used for attacking and capturing prey on which they feed by sucking out brain matter. Their arrival on Earth tends to be accompanied by a droning sound and a sudden temperature drop.

powers_and_abilities.name: Light Burn
powers_and_abilities.description: By expending 5 MP, can increase luminescence to cause 1D4 rounds of temporary blindness (CON roll fails). Continuing for subsequent rounds increases cost and severity (permanent blindness or death of the entity).

attacks.name: Consume
attacks.description: Latches to head and bores hole. Drains 2D10 INT and POW per round. Victim dies if INT or POW reaches zero. Causes 1D10 Sanity loss per round.

armor.modifiers: Can be harmed only with magic or fire-based attacks; cold and mundane weapons have no effect.

monster_entry.name: Spectral Hunter
monster_entry.subtitle: Monstrous Guardians
monster_entry.description: Invisible, one must procure the correct device to realize their horrific image. Large, hideous humanoids, and taller than most men. Their flesh is rubbery and mottled dark, their form horribly thin, with a distended abdomen. Hands and feet seem abnormally large... more like crab claws or pincers. A long and tapering nose sits below a pair of large red eyes.
monster_entry.main_entry_text: Spectral hunters are created from the bodies of willing human volunteers who agree to be transformed into monsters to guard sacred or important sites, tombs, and other locations. They do not speak and are invisible, but may manifest at will. These entities are formidable foes but possess a key weakness arising from the fact that certain forms of light make them visible to the human eye. Another weakness derives from them being physically tied to a specific location by an artifact.

powers_and_abilities.name: Invisible
powers_and_abilities.description: Invisibility imposes one penalty die on attempts to hit them, and grants them a bonus die to hit others.

powers_and_abilities.name: Binding
powers_and_abilities.description: Bound to a specific vessel. Cannot move more than one mile from it. If vessel is damaged, hunter suffers 1D8 damage. If destroyed, hunter is dispelled (or killed if Chant of Dismissal is spoken).

armor.modifiers: Immune to mundane weapons.

monster_entry.name: Sphinx, Children of the
monster_entry.subtitle: Ancient Warriors
monster_entry.description: They wait beneath the sands, birthed by the Great Sphinx. Each shaped as man and beast, with the heads of bulls, ibises, falcons, cats, crocodiles, hippopotamuses, and jackals. Robed, they guard the secret ways and enact the will of their masters, using ancient weapons to smite the unworthy.
monster_entry.main_entry_text: The children of the Sphinx appear as human-animal composites arising from Egyptian wildlife and mythology. These monstrosities come in great variety, usually with human bodies with animal, bird, or reptilian heads. Said to be the guardians and army of the Black Pharaoh, the children of the Sphinx can be encountered in tombs and catacombs associated to this avatar of Nyarlathotep.

monster_entry.name: Star Vampire
monster_entry.subtitle: Star Raveners
monster_entry.description: It moved about unseen, noticeable by only a waft of foul-smelling air and a weird chittering sound. Soon, its form was clear for us to see: for it began to feed... It was a bulging, pulsating sack of jelly from which a multitude of tentacular trunks emerged, each tipped with suckers to latch onto its victims. Supping on the offered lifeforce, it grew, bloated with the blood... Just a ravenous maw and collection of suckered trunks and wicked talons.
monster_entry.main_entry_text: Horrors that swim through the depths of space, they may descend to or be summoned to Earth. These loathsome things are normally invisible, their presence signaled by a sort of ghoulish tittering sound. While and after feeding, they become visible for at least 6 rounds through the blood they drink. Bestial and ravenous, they hunt down prey, feed, and then rest.

attacks.name: Seize (Maneuver)
attacks.description: Target is seized. On following round, can use bite attack to drain blood.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.description: Drains 3D10 STR per round. Victim regains 1D10 STR per day if they survive.

armor.modifiers: Bullets deal halved damaged. Invisible (penalty die to hit).

monster_entry.name: Swine Folk
monster_entry.subtitle: Magic Leeches
monster_entry.description: Grotesque once-humans... humanoids but with strange and swine-like faces. Their noses were snouts and their eyes little more than red dots in pale-white-pink leathery skin... About their hairless heads, their ears were extended and pig-like... What might have once been hands were webbed and gnarled claws.
monster_entry.main_entry_text: Swine people are a once-human race of subterranean dwellers who seem attracted to magic and spell casting; they seem to be particularly drawn to magical Gates. Some sorcerers suggest that these creatures are drawn to "feed" on magical vibrations. On Earth, they may be found in deep or wild places far away from society, but they may also be found in other dimensions or strange places, as well as Earth's Dreamlands.
monster_entry.spells: None; those with INT 70+ may know 1D3 spells.

monster_entry.name: Tcho-Tcho
monster_entry.subtitle: Mythos-Tainted Humans
monster_entry.description: In the main, they were below average human height... While the majority had thick dark hair, the older and balding ones revealed their heads to be dome-shaped. Apart from these more noticeable features, they appeared human in every way except for their teeth, which appeared to have been filed into sharp points or else crooked.
monster_entry.main_entry_text: Consensus suggests that the tcho-tcho are humans tainted by years of proximity to the Mythos, corrupting their genetics in varying degrees... What can be certain is that the tcho-tcho are not bound by any particular locale, as they may be encountered almost anywhere in the world... Those tcho-tcho who maintain and promote the Old Ways of cannibalism and sacrifice to such beings as Shub-Niggurath, Chaugnar Faugn, and Nyarlathotep are like a cancer to society.

powers_and_abilities.name: Black Lotus Affinity
powers_and_abilities.description: Mythos-aware tcho-tcho have an affinity with the black lotus, able to derive powerful drugs from this plant.

monster_entry.sanity_loss: No Sanity loss for seeing a tcho-tcho; 0/1D6 loss for realizing they are cannibals.

monster_entry.name: Terrors from Beyond
monster_entry.subtitle: Astral Hunters
monster_entry.description: Strange entities swam about us in the air, some pushing into one another and combining, others predatory... Many were inky, jellyfish-like monstrosities that resonated in harmony with some unknown vibration. They seemed semi-fluid and were never still... Putrescent, translucent bags of semisolid flesh, some trailing nests of writhing tendrils, while others possessed cruel fanged mouths.
monster_entry.main_entry_text: These terrors exist in a dimension beyond human perception, in a realm that overlays normal reality. Normally, terrors from beyond and creatures on Earth are unaware of each other, although specific triggers (mechanical, psychical, or magical) allow humans to become aware of the terrors—and the terrors to likewise become aware of their observers. These 'astral parasites' are normally invisible. Only when seen or otherwise sensed by a human may these parasites attack.

attacks.name: Burrow (Maneuver - Avg Form Only)
attacks.description: Burrows into flesh (1D6 damage). Once embedded, drains 1D6 points from every characteristic (except SIZ) once per day. SIZ decreases by 1 point per day. Only removable surgically or via specific conditions.

armor.modifiers: Regenerates 2 hit points per round (death at zero hit points).

monster_entry.spells: Average form knows no spells; Monstrous form may know 1D4 spells.

monster_entry.name: Tindalos, Hounds of
monster_entry.subtitle: Strange-Angled Beasts
monster_entry.description: They inhabit and move through the angles of time and space, able to materialize through physical angles... They assume differing forms, although most are comprised of many angles compressed into something akin to a Cubist nightmare and resembling a great hound or lizard dripping with a viscous blue fluid, with a maw filled with serrated teeth or reaching tongues.
monster_entry.main_entry_text: The hounds of Tindalos inhabit the angles of time, while other beings (such as humanity and all common life) descend from curves. The hounds prowl the corridors of time, seeking those who would cross the angles to other worlds and times, hunting them down to devour them in a malicious frenzy. Able to follow their prey through time and space, they are immortal and relentless hunters. Because of their relationship with the angles of time, they can materialize through any 'sharp' corner (120 degrees or less).

powers_and_abilities.name: Hyper-Sight
powers_and_abilities.description: Able to see an area (10 to 50 feet) as if in the fourth dimension—all directions, behind walls, inside containers. Grants a Dodge roll no matter the direction of the attack.

powers_and_abilities.name: Step-Through
powers_and_abilities.description: As long as sharp angles are within 5 yards, can step through via hyperspace to another angle anywhere in the spacetime it currently inhabits.

powers_and_abilities.name: Twist Space
powers_and_abilities.description: Costs 5 MP per round. Ripples local space-time. Those inside see themselves twisted (1/1D4 Sanity loss) and must make Extreme POW or CON roll or be incapacitated for 2D6 rounds.

attacks.name: Fighting
attacks.special_effect: Blue Ichor: Covered in bluish pus. Smears on victim dealing 2D6 damage per round until wiped off (DEX roll) or rinsed.

attacks.name: Tongue
attacks.special_effect: Creates a deep, painless hole-shaped wound. No physical damage, but permanently drains 3D6 POW.

armor.modifiers: Regenerates 4 hit points per round (death at zero hit points); immune to mundane weapons (enchanted weapons/spells deal full damage); shatters into crystal fragments at zero HP.

monster_entry.name: Tindalos, Lords of
monster_entry.subtitle: Masters of Angular Time
monster_entry.description: They appeared in curls of dark smoke, out of the corners of the room... Alien and unwholesome, their forms seemed to continually shift as though unstable but took on something that was somewhat humanoid, yet bestial, and composed of many sharp angles. Light seemed to dance around them, giving them a multispectral hue that was most disconcerting.
monster_entry.main_entry_text: The lords of Tindalos are creatures of otherworldly material rather than solid flesh. Their shapes appear sometimes humanoid and at others more wolf-like, but only wolf-like in that humans recognize their innate predaciousness. The lords of Tindalos are believed to the overseers of the hounds of Tindalos, although some claim they are one and the same. Rarely are the lords seen, visiting Earth only for significant reasons. Worshippers of Yog-Sothoth seem to abhor Tindalosians, as there appears to be a timeless war or struggle between these entities.

powers_and_abilities.name: Tindalosian Powers
powers_and_abilities.description: Can use all Tindalosian powers including Charnel Odor, Hyper-Sight, Step-Through, and Twist Space.

attacks.name: Fighting
attacks.special_effect: Blue Ichor deals 2D6 damage per round.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.special_effect: Swallows whole (up to SIZ 500). Victim takes 1D4 damage + 1D10 STR, DEX, CON, APP loss per round. Disintegrated in 1D10+6 rounds.

attacks.name: Tongue
attacks.special_effect: Creates hole-shaped wound. Drains 3D6 POW (permanent) and 3D6 STR (temporary).

armor.modifiers: Regenerates 8 hit points per round (death at zero hit points); immune to mundane weapons; shatters into crystal fragments at zero HP.

monster_entry.spells: Any, particularly those dealing with time and space.

monster_entry.name: Tindalosian Hybrid
monster_entry.subtitle: Multidimensional Killers
monster_entry.description: Soon, his face decayed and fell inward, resulting in the formation of wide and gaping maw equipped with crystalline fangs and a long blue-colored tongue. It is hard to define the final bodily shape... Wilson's physicality now resides partially in another dimension, as his form constantly changes and reshapes, with angular sections winking in and out of perception.
monster_entry.main_entry_text: Tindalosian hybrids are not a naturally-occurring species and originate from magic, science, or accident. Humans who ingest the blue ichor that coats both the hounds and lords of Tindalos may become infected, with the substance provoking a dramatic transformation. While roughly humanoid in shape, hybrids have been known to hide their appearance beneath heavy coats... When not bothering to keep a facsimile of human shape, a hybrid's visible portions change radically: hands appear as conglomerates of triangular crystals reminiscent of wolfish claws, while the face is replaced by what seems to be a wide gaping mouth.

powers_and_abilities.name: Phasing
powers_and_abilities.description: At a cost of 4 MP per round, can phase into hyper-dimensional space, becoming immune to mundane weapons.

attacks.name: Fighting
attacks.special_effect: Blue Ichor deals 2D6 damage per round.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.special_effect: Swallows whole (up to SIZ 100). Victim takes 1D4 damage + 1D10 STR, DEX, CON, APP loss per round.

attacks.name: Tongue
attacks.special_effect: Creates hole-shaped wound. Drains POW (permanent) and CON (temporary).

armor.modifiers: Regenerates 3 hit points per round (death at zero hit points).

monster_entry.name: Tomb-Herd
monster_entry.subtitle: Threshold Lurkers
monster_entry.description: Arrayed before us was the tomb-herd, a mass of foulness combined of many individuals, each a semi-humanoid- half-crustacean thing. Horrible, gelatinous forms that rolled, flopped, and spread. All a vivid white color, like an unspeakable gathering of monstrous things united in blasphemy.
monster_entry.main_entry_text: Insubstantial beings, they require vessels to interact on Earth... Said to be the progeny of Yog-Sothoth, the tomb-herd does not reside on Earth but rather in the curves of spacetime. Certain sites, tombs, and crypts are connected to Yog-Sothoth... Such places have stone effigies of the tomb-herd—strange humanoid crustacean forms—through which the tomb-herd manifests. The tomb-herd uses these horrific gargoylesque stone works as hosts to manifest in our world.

attacks.name: Smother (Statue Maneuver)
attacks.description: Mass group attack (requires 4+ tomb-herd). Opponents smothered and asphyxiate. 1D6 damage per round.

armor.modifiers: Natural form is immune to all attacks (except spells/artifacts). Statue form takes normal damage from mundane weapons.

monster_entry.name: Tsathoggua, Scions of
monster_entry.subtitle: Chittering Toad Things
monster_entry.description: Enormous, it was a bloated and greasy toad-thing, possessing a great, jelly-like bulk. Four or more ugly-thick legs terminated in large hooves, while dozens of tentacles, and a pair of huge, tattered and membranous wings sprouted from its slimy back. Curving fangs extended from the bony ridges of a wide mouth below many unblinking and throbbing milky white eyes.
monster_entry.main_entry_text: Tsathoggua's scions are innumerably old and are believed to have come from Saturn with that deity... These toad-like, winged beings may also have connections to (or worship) other Great Old Ones. These entities produce an unnerving, child-like tittering... They may be encountered dwelling in caverns and temples where their alien god is worshiped, accepting sacrifices and devotion, and acting as guardians.

attacks.name: Fighting
attacks.special_effect: Can attack with 2D6 tentacles per round.

armor.modifiers: Minimum damage from mundane weapons due to mucous-like bodies.

monster_entry.spells: 10% chance to know 1D6 spells (Contact Tsathoggua, Call Ossadagowah, Contact Formless Spawn).

monster_entry.name: Ubbo-Sathla, Brood of
monster_entry.subtitle: The Lurching Ones
monster_entry.description: Gray-white, some translucent, some multi-colored, they mimic protozoa-amoebas, stentors, didymium, and euglena-yet on a much greater scale. Some lurch while others scurry... while others preen and tend like birds upon an elephant, picking and eating parasites from the god's body.
monster_entry.main_entry_text: Ubbo-Sathla constantly produces offspring from its formless mass. Most are immediately snatched up and devoured, although many escape. Those surviving this initial culling tend to remain close, fulfilling every whim and urge of their primal, mindless sire. Generally, they are encountered only in Ubbo-Sathla's primal grotto... No two spawns are exactly alike. They are similar in appearance to giant versions of protozoans and other one-celled creatures, each as strange and unwholesome as the next.

attacks.name: Grab (Maneuver)
attacks.description: Attacks with sticky filaments or pseudopods to pull target into mass. Consumes by squirting digestive juices (1D6 damage). Opposed STR to escape. For every 5 damage suffered, victim loses 1D10 APP.

attacks.name: Jump/Leap (Maneuver)
attacks.description: Leaps onto target to smother/digest.

armor.modifiers: Impaling weapons (incl. bullets) deal minimum damage; fire and enchanted weapons deal normal damage.

monster_entry.name: Voor
monster_entry.subtitle: Subterranean Horrors
monster_entry.description: Small humanoids with pale and hairless whitish bodies, covered with glistening slime. Their heads are reminiscent of an infant, with puffy and swollen flesh within which are set nostril slits and a crude sphincter-like mouth. There are no eyes, just smooth wet skin. They wore no clothing and moved in a manner that suggested a snake twisting and writhing. They are repugnant and horrid.
monster_entry.main_entry_text: In the ancient past, before the Ice Age, the voor were a powerful and prosperous race, building cities and worshipping strange gods. With the rise of humanity, the voor were driven underground and forgotten... Generations of living in the lightless worlds beneath the earth, the voor found no use for their eyes, developing into blind, albino-like creatures who hunt by sound and smell alone. Today, it can be assumed the voor are close to extinction... Voors continue to practice their worship of dark gods, including holding sacrifices to entities like Tsathoggua, Abhoth, Atlach-Nacha, and Ubbo-Sathla.

attacks.name: Strangulation (Maneuver)
attacks.description: If successful surprise attack, holds throat. Victim suffers 1D2 damage/round. May lose consciousness (CON roll) at half HP. Opposed STR to break free.

armor.modifiers: Direct sunlight causes 1 damage per round.

monster_entry.spells: None; shaman-like priest may know 1D6 spells.

monster_entry.name: Voormis
monster_entry.subtitle: Savage Humanoids
monster_entry.description: Three-toed humanoids, covered in brown or umber-colored fur, who crouch and stand half-erect. Their hands end in sharp, talon-like claws, and their faces are canine in aspect. Emitting both guttural cries and sharp, high-pitched shrieks, they are aggressive of nature, cruel, and wish to make war on others.
monster_entry.main_entry_text: The voormis are a race of primitive humanoids that dwell in caverns, other forgotten places, and the Dreamlands. Possibly now extinct, rumors persist of isolated tribes existing in the northern hemisphere. These creatures are thought to be the ancestors of the sasquatch and yeti, and their mutated cousins have given rise to folklore concerning trolls. Normally nocturnal, voormis are savage and cunning hunters... Mutated or primal voormis are distinct from normal voormis, being significantly larger, more brutal, and bestial.

armor.rating: 2-point thick fur (Average) / 4-point thick hide and fur (Mutated)

monster_entry.spells: None; shaman may know Contact Formless Spawn, Contact Tsathoggua, Evil Eye, Shrivelling.

monster_entry.name: Wind-Walker
monster_entry.subtitle: Chosen of Ithaqua
monster_entry.description: Once men, they now dance upon the cold winds and their howl freezes the blood. Called by the Great Wind-Walker to hear its chilling song are they who forsake all others to be blessed by his touch. Growing hoof-like growths where once were feet, while ice water instead of blood flows through their veins. Bestial and skeletal things, with a deaths-head face, hoar-frosted hair, and long boney fingers and hooked nails.
monster_entry.main_entry_text: Humans directly touched by the Great Wind-Walker, Ithaqua, may become transformed into wind-walkers... As the transformation takes hold (anywhere between 24 to 48 hours or more), the urges are less controllable, grow stronger, and last longer. Eventually, nothing of the person they once were remains... Wind-walkers tend to be found only in the region of the North Pole; thus, North America, Canada, Russia, Norway, and Greenland.

powers_and_abilities.name: Sky Dance
powers_and_abilities.description: Some wind-walkers possess the ability to "run" through the air, a means of travel akin to flying.

powers_and_abilities.name: Ice Heart
powers_and_abilities.description: The only way to kill a wind-walker is to plunge a burning stake/knife into its cold heart, cut it out and burn it to ashes (penalty die to attack heart). If not destroyed, it rises again at next sunset.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.special_effect: Victim must make POW roll or be struck with absolute terror (frozen or flee) for 1D6+1 rounds. Bitten person has cumulative 1% chance of becoming a wind-walker.

armor.modifiers: Immune to cold.

monster_entry.name: Xiclotl, Being from
monster_entry.subtitle: Tree-like Aliens
monster_entry.description: They originate from another world unknown to us. Beings that look like bizarre metal trees, with cylindrical "trunks" and "branches." Rising to 16 feet in height, their six branch-like arms circle the central trunk... Rising from the top of the trunk is an oval-shaped head containing a large and open orifice through which it feeds.
monster_entry.main_entry_text: These carnivorous aliens come from the planet of Xiclotl... Not a spacefaring race, these entities were brought to Earth by the Shan (insects from Shaggai) who first visited Xiclotl, enslaving the planet's inhabitants... The Shan use the easily controlled Xiclotlans as a labor force, sometimes using them to guard their secrets on Earth.

attacks.name: Fighting
attacks.special_effect: May simultaneously use all six of their branch-like tentacles.

attacks.name: Seize (Maneuver)
attacks.description: May swallow creatures up to half its SIZ (DB damage per round). Otherwise, seized victims may be devoured (1D6/round) or crushed (DB). Opposed DEX or STR to escape.

armor.modifiers: Cold-based attacks deal double damage.

monster_entry.name: Y'golonac, Servant of
monster_entry.subtitle: Whispering Horrors
monster_entry.description: With folds of flabby skin, they seem like nightmarish babies or children, drooling and wretched. Blind, they have empty sockets, as though their lord has ripped out their eyes... Perhaps most terrible are the palms, each possessing a tooth-filled mouth. It is from these mouths, rather than the drooling ones on their faces, through which they speak and rend and eat.
monster_entry.main_entry_text: Y'golonac's brood is plentiful and abundant. Attending to their lord's needs and desires, these small creatives appear as deformed humanoids... Sometimes naked, sometimes cloaked in dirty and tattered rags... Most believe both Y'golonac and its servants are bound and imprisoned... When ritual summoning or other arcane workings temporarily free the deity, it brings its servants with it.

powers_and_abilities.name: Corrupting Influence
powers_and_abilities.description: Exposure to whispers for several days causes corruption. Countered by daily POW roll. Failure leads to consumption by vice and loss of 1D8 Sanity/day. 5 failures leads to total servitude.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.special_effect: Mouths in each palm and face bite. Usually swarm opponents.

monster_entry.name: Yig, Children of
monster_entry.subtitle: Monstrous Snakes
monster_entry.description: Know the children of Yig by the white crescent mark upon their heads... These monster snakes are directed by Yig's will or that of the god's servants and may be found guarding sacred sites or artifacts. Otherwise, they may be directed to seek and strike at those who have displeased Yig.
monster_entry.main_entry_text: The children of Yig are large snakes that bear Yig's mark on their heads, that of a white crescent. Usually, such snakes are above-average sized venomous members of their species common to the locale (e.g. diamondback rattlesnakes, copperheads, cottonmouths). They are relentless hunters who trail their target until able to strike. Having bitten the target, the chosen of Yig does not remain to fight but disappears as suddenly as it arrived.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.special_effect: Venom is strong (2D10 damage), causes agony and usually death. Extreme CON roll halves damage.

monster_entry.name: Yig, Spawn of
monster_entry.subtitle: Blessed of the Snake God
monster_entry.description: Born of a human mother... his skin becoming dry and flaky before the scales started to appear... In the end, he looked like a walking snake, with talons instead of nails, a bifurcated tongue, and lidless black eyes.
monster_entry.main_entry_text: The spawn of Yig are the hybrid offspring of Yig and a human or a serpent person. Those blessed/cursed usually transform over a matter of days. Hybrid humans tend to rapidly lose their sanity as the transformation reaches a conclusion. Most have a scaly skin, colored similarly to that of a snake, sometimes with shrunken or vestigial limbs that dangle uselessly from their sides.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.special_effect: Venom causes 1D10 damage and unconsciousness (1D6 rounds). Extreme CON halves damage/time.

attacks.name: Swallow (Maneuver)
attacks.description: Swallows opponent whole (limit equal/under spawn's SIZ). Digests prey over 1D4+1 days.

monster_entry.name: Yith, Great Race of (Beetle Form)
monster_entry.subtitle: Future Hive Minds
monster_entry.description: A beetle-like species possessed of the minds of those called the Great Race. These entities, with jet-black shells and wings of brilliant blue, gold, and green hues, will be joined, working together as one to recreate the Great Race's splendor.
monster_entry.main_entry_text: Foreseeing their potential destruction by the flying polyps, the Great Race of Yith transferred their minds far into the future of Earth, well beyond the extinction of humanity, into swarms of intelligent beetle-like creatures that possess hive-minds. Each swarm (consisting of approximately 500 individual insects) operates as a single entity.

armor.modifiers: Area effect weapons must be deployed to successfully destroy a swarm.

monster_entry.spells: 10% chance per swarm of knowing 1D4 spells.

monster_entry.name: Yith, Great Race of (Cone Form)
monster_entry.subtitle: Time Brains
monster_entry.description: Some ten feet high and ten feet in diameter at their base, they are cone-shaped entities with iridescent coarse and scaly skin. At the top of the cone, four tentacle-like limbs thrust forth... two of these ended with crab-like claws, the third terminated in four red colored trumpet-like growths... while the fourth limb carried a yellow orb... around which grew three eyes.
monster_entry.main_entry_text: Yithians are a race of incorporeal mind entities. They mastered time travel and fled their own world's destruction by migrating their minds to a race of cone-shaped entities living on Earth during the Devonian era. They value intelligence and scientific reasoning. A member of the race can send its mind forward or backward through time and across space to trade minds with a suitable subject.

attacks.name: Lightning Gun
attacks.description: Standard Model A fires bursts of electricity. Can fire multiple charges at once (risk of burnout).

monster_entry.name: Yog-Sothoth, Children of
monster_entry.subtitle: Outer God Progeny
monster_entry.description: It was huge, bigger than a barn, and composed of a mass of squirming rope-like tubes. Its total shape was like a hen's egg, a great jelly with dozens of legs like hogsheads, and great bulging eyes all along the sides... Atop the jelly mass was a human-seeming face.
monster_entry.main_entry_text: The spawn of Yog-Sothoth are formed when the Outer God mates with or channels a part of itself into a human, creating a hybrid creature. Some may look mostly human with a goat-like face and possess some alien traits (like Wilbur Whateley) or be terribly alien, monstrous, and/or invisible. Most mature rapidly and require great quantities of fresh meat.

attacks.name: Grab (Maneuver)
attacks.description: Tentacles grab and crush or suck blood.

armor.modifiers: Monstrous spawn cannot be harmed by mundane weapons; enchanted weapons deal minimum damage. Monstrous spawn are invisible.

monster_entry.name: Yugg
monster_entry.subtitle: Ocean Lurkers
monster_entry.description: Bloated and swollen, some four feet in diameter and over twelve feet high, it reminded me of a great worm or slug, and had a large circular mouth, ringed with horn-like teeth that recalled a hagfish or lamprey eel. About its head and mouth were numerous tentacles.
monster_entry.main_entry_text: These large, pale, and gray worm or slug-like creatures dwell almost exclusively in the depths of the Pacific Ocean. They are intelligent and have a society of sorts. Some believe they arrived from another planet to pay homage to the Great Old One known as Zoth-Ommog.

attacks.name: Hold (Maneuver)
attacks.description: Latches on. Drains blood (1D6+1 HP + 4D10 STR per round). Opposed STR to break free.

monster_entry.name: Xo tl'mi-go
monster_entry.subtitle: Children of the Kingdom
monster_entry.description: Activity. Those captured are usually eaten by the xo tl'mi-go community, although it is said they favor capturing children to raise them as their own, using strange drugs, magic, or ritual to transform a human child into a xo tl'mi-go.
monster_entry.main_entry_text: Little is known of their origins, but they appear to be a distinct race. They suffer from photophobia and cannot tolerate strong light; even a flashlight beam causes them to back away, while very strong light (daylight or intense beams) may harm their senses. They are adapted to the dark and suffer no penalties for operating in total darkness.
monster_entry.spells: None; those with INT 70+ may know 1D4 spells.

monster_entry.name: Yaddith, Denizen of
monster_entry.subtitle: Alien Sorcerer-Scientists
monster_entry.description: Curious beings from the dead planet of Yaddith, who fled that world's destruction. Sorcerous scientists, the Yaddithians are humanoid, with two legs and arms, and tapering head possessing a short trunk-like proboscis. Their rugose skin is partially squamous, with articulated joints that give it the appearance of an insect crossed with a mammal.
monster_entry.main_entry_text: Yaddithians fled their home world when their efforts to prevent an infestation of dholes came to naught. Subsequently, they traveled far by means of strange technology, and have shown a particular interest in our solar system, specifically regarding Earth and Mars. Brilliant scientists and powerful wizards, the Yaddithians have developed devices, known as "light-wave envelopes," which can convey small groups through space.

attacks.name: Tube Pistol
attacks.special_effect: Alien beam weapon.

attacks.name: Tube Rifle
attacks.special_effect: Alien beam weapon.

monster_entry.name: Horse of the Invisible
monster_entry.subtitle: Ghostly Steed-like Creatures
monster_entry.description: Powerful entities that are completely powerless, silent, and invisible during daylight hours. Between sundown and sunrise, however, they are terrifying and powerful entities. They may be summoned or attracted by intense suffering.
monster_entry.main_entry_text: A horse of the invisible is tied to a specific lair until dispelled back to their home plane or slain. They possess telekinetic powers while invisible and immaterial (pushing objects/people). To physically manifest, a horse must expend magic points. Once coalesced, it can maintain its form between sundown and sunrise. If reduced to zero hit points while physical, it dispels until the next sundown. Truly killing it requires reducing its POW to zero.

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.special_effect: Victims killed by a single bite are bitten in half (head/torso never found).

armor.modifiers: Suffers 1 damage from all physical attacks; magical weapons deal normal damage. Regenerates fully at sundown unless POW reduced to zero.

monster_entry.sanity_loss: 0/1D6 to encounter corporeal form; 0/1D2 to hear hooves/neighing.

monster_entry.name: Jersey Devil
monster_entry.subtitle: Haunter of the Pine Barrens
monster_entry.description: A hooved, flying bipedal creature said to inhabit the Pine Barrens of Southern New Jersey. Bizarre tracks of single-file hoof prints are often the only evidence.
monster_entry.main_entry_text: This monster is believed responsible for killing livestock. Its tracks start and end abruptly, are always in a perfectly straight line—even going up and over roofs. Use this profile to suit other strange creatures lurking at the fringes of civilization, such as the Almas, Barmanu, Chupacabra, Fouke Monster, or Skunk Ape.

monster_entry.name: Lake Monster
monster_entry.subtitle: Mysterious Watery Wonders
monster_entry.description: Large, elusive creatures that generally possess long eel-like bodies or short, squat bodies with long tails and very long necks. They have small heads and typically are equipped with four paddle-like flippers.
monster_entry.main_entry_text: Lake monsters may grow up to 16 or more yards/meters long. Some claim that these mysterious creatures are descendants of the surviving specimens of prehistoric species (plesiosaurs). Usually timid and shy away from humans, but might attack if forced into a situation where they could not escape, or if their young were threatened.

monster_entry.name: Man-Eating Plant
monster_entry.subtitle: Coniferous Carnivores
monster_entry.description: Can take on any form, from gigantic versions of real plants to fantastical creations like serpentine-tendrilled trees or enticing flowers that close around their intended prey. Some emit caustic acids, some have blood sucking thorns, others have vines or leaves that snare or crush.
monster_entry.main_entry_text: Legends and pulp fiction are full of exotic jungles populated by man-eating plants. Carnivorous plants may be sentient, intelligent, and able to move, or they may be rooted to the spot. Such plants can occur naturally in deep, uncharted locations, be mutants, or creations of crazed scientists.

attacks.name: Trap (mnvr)
attacks.description: Uses body or portion to trap prey. Caught prey is held and consumed (slowly or fast). Escape with opposed STR or Hard/Extreme DEX.

armor.modifiers: Regenerates 1D6 or more per round.

monster_entry.name: Megalodon
monster_entry.subtitle: Big-Tooth Shark
monster_entry.description: The largest specimen of shark ever discovered, possessing teeth 7 inches (18 cm) long, and a bite radius of approximately 6 feet (1.8 m).
monster_entry.main_entry_text: This creature (living approximately 23 to 3.6 million years ago) could grow to lengths of up 100 feet (30 m) and weigh up to 100 tons or more. In most other respects it was like the great white sharks of today, constantly swimming and feeding on whatever it could find.

monster_entry.name: Mummy
monster_entry.subtitle: Husks of Horror
monster_entry.description: Undead beings similar to intelligent zombies. Some act as temple guardians.
monster_entry.main_entry_text: Like zombies, mummies must be hacked apart to make them cease action. Contrary to popular belief, many mummies lack bandage wrappings and can move relatively swiftly. Some mummies cannot naturally regenerate magic points.

armor.modifiers: Impaling weapons deal half damage; bullets deal 1 damage. Fire deals normal damage first 2 rounds, then double damage.

monster_entry.name: Sasquatch
monster_entry.subtitle: Giant Hairy Hominid
monster_entry.description: Standing over 7 feet (2 m) tall and covered in a reddish brown-colored thick hair.
monster_entry.main_entry_text: Elusive, hairy giant hominids who prowl the remote corners of the world. Sasquatch seem to be nocturnal and omnivorous. They are intelligent and generally shy, but can be aggressive if threatened.

monster_entry.name: Zombie
monster_entry.subtitle: The Unquiet Dead
monster_entry.description: The dead brought back to life. They may be slow or fast, exist to perform a task or consume the living.
monster_entry.main_entry_text: Zombies may be created by magic, chemical spills, wrath of gods, or science. Most have low POW (05) and minimal INT, under control of a creator or are animalistic eating machines. Some may be indestructible, requiring dismemberment.

armor.modifiers: Major wound results in loss of limb. Otherwise ignore damage except to head (one penalty die to target head).

monster_entry.sanity_loss: 0/1D4 to encounter fresh zombie; 1/1D6 to encounter decaying corpse.
